title: Honolulu to consider limits on South Shore surfing contests
text:
HONOLULU (AP) - Honolulu officials are considering setting limits on surfing contests held on Oahu’s South Shore.

The Honolulu Star-Advertiser reported Monday that the limits could be similar to those set on North Shore surfing contests, which are limited to 16 per site between 8 a.m. and 4 p.m.

An official says prospective changes would need to be presented in a public hearing, which could happen as early as summer 2020.

The city Parks and Recreation Department says the frequency of South Shore surfing contests has drawn complaints.

Officials say the goal of limits would be to prevent local surfers from being frequently prevented access to their favorite areas.

The parks department says the South Shore hosted seven events in Waikiki over 28 days in fiscal year 2019, which ended June 30.
